website_summaries.verdict: If you’re looking for an inexpensive, fairly quiet, and simple filter to efficiently keep a smaller aquarium clean, Tetra’s Whisper filters are worth your consideration.
pros: Utilizes mechanical, chemical, and biological filtration methods
cons: Suction cups would have been a more convenient way to secure it to your aquarium than its plastic clip

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We recently acauired an unplanned fish so I needed a cheap filter for a 10 gallon fish tank quick. I also wanted one that was relatively quiet. This one was the cheapest and it had relatively good reviews, so I decided to try it, and I'm glad I did! After plugging it in, it made noise for a few seconds, but then went completely silent. It took only a few minutes more to clear up the water. Finally, the water flow was strong enough to circulate the whole tank without being so strong it pushed the fish around. I would recommend. Standard pen shown for size
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Almost no noise at all comes from this filter.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a turtle tank with less than 7 gls of water in it. The water reaches a third of the filter high and the only noise comes from the water falling. My only complain is that the disposable filter is suppose to last a month but that might be the case for a fish tank, but for a turtle, after only 10 days the filter is already brown with turtle waist and the water flow is almost nonexistent. The disposable filters cost 7.5 dollars for a 12 pack which means that a hole year of filters will run for 15 dollars. Pretty cheap considering the fact that other pets have very hight maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Rz

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS, SERIOUSLY.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying this product, it had good reviews but I was wary of one review that said his fish has gotten sucked into the intake. Despite this I bought the filter anyway and it worked ok but I could tell my Betta didn’t like it very much. Sure enough I came home today and my he had been sucked into the filter and killed, his fins ripped to bits. Seriously DO NOT BUY THIS. Clearly whatever moron designed it didn’t bother with any product testing. I promptly ripped it out of the wall and hucked it across the street. Will not be buying any Tetra products ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Magnetyk

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my previous filter with this one and it's been working fine for a year.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 5 gallon acrylic tank, and the supplied filter didn't have any kind of bio capability. So I immediately replaced it with this unit. I still have to do weekly water changes because I have a heavy fish load for a five gallon tank. But the carbon filtration filter is easy to change, this filter does a great job circulating and turning over the water capacity, and the extra help from the bio insert is beneficial. I'd buy this filter again if it quit working. I've had this one for over a year now and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: JcatTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It killed my fish.
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this filter for my Rosey Red minnows and it came on time I installed it pretty simply but the current was to strong. My fish got pulled toward it and I quickly unplugged it. They were fine for a few hours but then I noticed my two girls were missing. They died. I'm so heart broken right now I took the ones left out put them in quarantine to see if they make it through the night 💔 please do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Moniger

customer_reviews.title: Killed our guppie
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews before purchasing this filter as a replacement in my sons 3 gallon tank. It had 2 guppies that he won at the school fair 2.5 years ago. I changed the filter because the one in there wasn’t efficient at circulating the tank. I literally replaced it this afternoon and tonight at bedtime when I went to check the tank the littlest guppie was missing. I found him inside the filter, dead. His fins all mangled. He got sucked up in the filter. After 2.5 years, he died because of this filter. My son is very sad. I should have listened to the warnings. Hopefully this will save someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best low priced filter!
customer_reviews.text: I've used many filers over the years, of various brands and styles. This is my absolute favorite. I have purchased several from Amazon in various sizes for different tanks. They are more powerful than standard back-of-the-tank filters, are much less likely to become clogged, and since it is a single piece, much easier to clean. It can hang at an adjustable level, making it ideal for both aquariums and turtle/newt setups. I have them in use for turtles as well as standard aquariums, and am thrilled. Obviously, in the turtle tanks there is more of a trickling, waterfall effect, so it is louder but not unpleasant. Definitely worth purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: The Village Idiot

customer_reviews.title: Great filters for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this style of tetra filter for years. They are wonderful! So quiet! I mostly like them because I adjust them to use foam and bio media, like how you'd set up an external canister filter. And since the water comes up from the bottom in this filter it works great for this adaptation. I hadn't bought one for some time and I see they have somewhat changed the design of how they hang on the tank. Not sure how I like the new design. It works fine. Maybe even better than the old. Time will tell I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Green girl 87

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!! it truly is WHISPER quiet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought an aquarium kit for my child to get him started on caring for his first pet. Alas, the filter that came with the kit was INCREDIBLY loud. Since the aquarium sits in his bedroom, I needed something a lot quieter. Bought this one and another one to try. figured I would compare a budget friendly one to a not so budget friendly one and see what happens. The moment I plugged this one in, i was SHOCKED. Other than a very mild hum, there was no noise. It was perfect for a bedroom, noise level wise. Will update after a month on how easy it is to clean and if it does a proper job of filtering!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Want to love it...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this filter. It fits my small tank perfectly and is easy to maintain. Unfortunately, it keeps getting clogged. I bought my first one in February for my two tadpoles. It worked well for about 4 weeks, and then the flow slowed down dramatically. Of course I changed the filter every week, but the motor box is what got clogged up. I rinsed the entire system every two weeks, but this still happened. So I bought a second one hoping I could prevent any build up. Well, I've had it less than three weeks now and it's already slowed down. At least this one I can return since it's within the 30 days return time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Soper

customer_reviews.title: killed my frog
customer_reviews.text: it just sucked my frog right up and killed it. 11/25/2018 update i tried using this again in my 10 gallon guppies tank and it suck my guppy right up and killed her. i will not use again. stay away if you love your fish
customer_reviews.author: shadowgaurdian

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for aquatic turtle
customer_reviews.text: I use this filter for an aquatic turtle in a 20L tank. It has been the only filter in the tank for about a year now. I have been impressed with its performance. It keeps the tank clean, is relatively quiet and the filters are cheap and easy to replace. We clean the tank about every two weeks including the filter and my only complaint is there are components of the filter that cannot be thoroughly cleaned. This hasn't changed the functionality of the filter and for the most part I can clean most of the gunk off of it. Considering the price of this filter it is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: kelly fry

customer_reviews.title: It kills fish!!! Dont buy!!! They get sucked into it
customer_reviews.text: Today i threw my filter away. I have had it 4 months it killed 3 of my fish. I am beyond upset, before this thing I had my goldfish alive for 4 years!!!! He was healthy and beautiful and now dead. Dont buy unless u want a dead fish. This should be recalled. I want my money back on this. Not happy!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MandyMayz

customer_reviews.title: The best water filter I've encountered at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: This filter is absolutely phenomenal for my Chinese Water Dragon's enclosure. Has managed to clean the CWDS dropping fairly well in the short time I've had it with the water remaining crystal clear. This filter creates a perfect waterfall about 3 inches wide that my lizard LOVES to relax under. I was able to find a pack of 12 large filter cartridges meant for the Tetra 40i for $7 on Amazon as well. That equals out to $22 for a great water filter & 3 years of cartridges!! As with all recycled filters, there's a slight risk of small fish getting sucked into the water suction slots. Highly reccomended!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I like it tank water really clean with it FYI i have a 3 gallons tank
customer_reviews.author: FatenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: My BROKEN filter works better than this new bigger/more 'powerful' one. I cleaned my turtle tank THREE DAYS ago, two days later, I could smell it in every room. Cleaned it again YESTERDAY and today it smells 3 weeks old agains! Filter cartridges have been full of gunk after ONE feeding. Whisper quiet? Sure but whats the point if I have to clean my tank daily instead of every 2-3 weeks with a BROKEN filter???
customer_reviews.author: Malbec

customer_reviews.title: Great filter but the hanger on back is not great
customer_reviews.text: The actual filter is wonderful, quiet, effective, simple to use, easy to clean, and overall a wonderful product. The only thing that is not great is the hang-on-back feature, it is not adjustable and doesn't fit most of my tanks/falls off very easily. The suction cups don't stay adhered reliably long term (algae and fish bumping it both cause it to come off of the tank wall) I ended up heat shaping some acrylic and making my own back hanger, but a better adjustable one that would actually fit most tanks would make this the perfect filter right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Loud. Certainly not whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3-10 gallon filter to set up my new 10G tank. Set up was very easy and the filter pad and scrubber are included which is nice. HOwever the pump is quite loud. I'm talking about the pump noise, not the water noise. The water is pouring out of the top when the pump is running and there's a little bit of water noise that's very understandable. However there's this monotone pump motor noise which is very disturbing. My tank is in my living room next to my couch. I found it very bothersome to watch TV on my couch. Very disappointed by the product.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a filter that came with the aquarium that was super loud. It’s a 2 gallon tank. Arrived on a timely fashion, followed instructions and turned it on. Wow. Super quiet, I have to actually turn everything off to hear it running. Really easy to change the filters and had the water cleaned up in about 5 minutes. My only complaint is the top lid cover is flimsy. The clip for it broke after the second month filter change. Doesn’t really matter as I have it rigged, but was annoyed when it happens. I hade it quite a while now. No issues with pump, does it’s job and also oxygenates the water. Well worth what I paid
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough For My Frogs
customer_reviews.text: The suction rate isn't fantastic, but it's good enough for my frogs. This was really loud when I first plugged it in, but quieted down after a few seconds and has stayed quiet since. It's nice and small and fits great in my 360° 3-gal tank. I'm using this tank as a temporary tank for four young leucistic african dwarf frogs until they are big enough to move to my main tank, but the filter that came with this tank was atrocious. This is a great upgrade and my frogs almost immediately seemed happier with the added flow rate compared to before.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy K.

customer_reviews.title: I love it so far!! :) UPDATE: Ehhhhh
customer_reviews.text: So far, It is a quiet and low flow filter, perfect for my betta!!! What is a downside is that there isn't much room inside to put other forms of media, but it does what it's supposed to. I recently filled my tank with a new substrate for live plants and stains orange a bit. The filter picked a bunch of loose debris and powder right up!! It's impressive. I recommend it :) UPDATE: I switched back to my other filter. The pull of water at the bottom is TOO strong, and the ammonia is not decreasing. I don't know if it's the cartridge that comes with or what, bit it doesn't do it for me.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Killed all our fish
customer_reviews.text: The filter cleans the water fine, but it has now killed three of our guppies. Its too strong for the little 3 gallon tank we have. The fish get sucked into the filter and become trapped and die. We rescued one yesterday but its fin had already been shredded off and it later died.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best filter, period.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a while since I’ve had a tank with a filter but we had to get one for my son’s goldfish since they are really dirty fish. I was very happy to see one for $7 for my 10 gallon tank. Since the reviews were good I decided to try it. Set up was super simple, easier then I remember. It is so quiet even without a high water level and best of all it keeps the tank crystal clear clean. I am amazed. Don’t hesitate to buy this. My tank is small but it cleans it so fast that I’m sure it could easily handle a 20 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vega

customer_reviews.title: This is a great in tank filter!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have any issues with flow, noise, or fit. It came with both suction cups and hanger. The only time I had noise was when it was sitting a little funny on the edge of tank. I literally just touched it and it settled on well enough where there was no noise at all! As for cleaning, yes, it's hard to clean the inside when you want to, but I change the filter much more than I clean the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Birello

customer_reviews.title: Took a Couple of Tries
customer_reviews.text: EDIT (5/14/2020): Well, I ended up pulling them from the tanks. Both started rattling and by buzzing. Bought a different set of small HOB filters to try. Lowering review to two stars. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I bought two of these for a pair of small five gallon tanks. On one of them, the pump started rattling before intermittently stopping and restarting. Those small powerheads have that problem sometimes. The replacement worked (so far).
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: Work well, good value, great for quarantine tank
customer_reviews.text: This is similar to (though slightly upgraded) the ones that come with the 10 gallon sets at a local store. I have three of those and bought this to use with a quarantine tank. They work well, don't take up too much space. The best feature for me is that I can easily transfer filter material from my main tank filter to this filter to maintain the beneficial bacteria (cycle) when I need to setup a quarantine tank. Good value for the money, too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this filter to replace an old Marineland filter in my 6 gallon Eclipse aquarium. My old filter was made to perfectly fit across the top of the tank. This filter actually hangs on the side and goes inside the tank, which I like because it means the top still fits on my tank. It doesn’t take up too much room in the tank, the current isn’t too strong (maybe slightly stronger than the old filter), and it’s pretty quiet. Excellent filter and can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money!!!!!! Don't buy no matter how cheap it is!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a negative star I would. This is the worst filter I have ever had! The water runs out the back. It's a mess! Also the instructions have alot of foreign languages and a small amount of English. They expect a single suction cup to hold this entire filter in place with a cheaply made clamp. This is horrible. Now my fish will likely die before I can get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motor is sentive to sudden power loss
customer_reviews.text: The filter really does make a huge difference. The reason why I'm only giving it 4 stars is because we have had to replace it once and then almost again recently. We have it hooked up to a serge protecting power strip. However when we lost power it broke the motor. Then again recently I blew the fuse and it stopped working again. Some how after tapping on it and hitting it on the dresser lightly it started working again. It does not have a power button so all shutoffs are sudden. The filters for this however do last a decent amount of time in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Moore

customer_reviews.title: Minimal performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter because the 10 gallon version worked extremely well. My experience with this one has not been the same. It's only in a 35 gallon tank (40 gallon filter) with tetras and does not keep it clean as expected.
customer_reviews.author: L. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: I love this filter. It's quiet, small, simply designed, and cheap. I've had mine running in a 5.5 gallon for several months now, and it has been pretty good. My only complaint is the suction cups; I hate them. They poke into the two holes on the back of the filter, and they pop out every time you pop the filter off to clean it. It's a pain to get the suction cups back onto the filter once they pop off as well. Not a huge deal, but still irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product Downgrade unannounced?
customer_reviews.text: Got one last year, having great experience with it. I ordered three more this year, but they arrived with bio-scrapper changed to bio-foam. The front GREEN piece of plastic, sturdy bio-scrapper has changed to a piece of thin BLACK coarse foam. In terms of durability, bio-scrapper definitely outshines a piece of thin foam. I wasn't very happy because I got 3 downgraded filters at increased cost without prior notice. In addition, I can't even click "problem with order" because there is no such button.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fang

customer_reviews.title: It's quite
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do and not only that it's quite, this surprised me because most of the reviews say that it's not quite but mines is, the only thing I can hear is the hum it makes and that's when I put my ear closer to the tank. I'm planning to d i.y. (pimp my filter) to make it filter better later
customer_reviews.author: death heart

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. I have it in a 10 gallon tank for a turtle so it is not filled to the top. Its filed about maybe 1/5th of the way. We used it and within a few days the water was murky and smelly and the outside of the filter was dirty. We tried it again, replacing the filter cartridge and cleaning the filter and the same thing happened again. I guess that's what happens when you cheap out.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: More Headache Than I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my axolotl tank. I have two juvenile axolotls I wanted to test a filter with, instead of a sponge filter. Noise is almost nonexistent, however the clip is the dumbest thing and the suction cups do not stay in. They seem to get pushed out by water pressure. So I had to be creative before I lost my mind and sent it back. If you're a person who wants a filter, puts it in, and wants nothing to do with it until it is time to change it...dont pick this.
customer_reviews.author: BiologyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Great silent filter
customer_reviews.text: I have this filter in a 5 gallon tank. It is quite large for this tank. I think it would be better in a 10 gallon tank. However, it is silent. I have this tank in my bedroom and I am very sensitive to sounds in the night. I don't even realize this is in my room, it is that silent. It cleans the water nicely, although I don't think my one little betta is creating too much mess. I don't know how it would perform with a goldfish tank, for example, but as powerful as it seems, I imagine it would work well. It is easy to clean and maintain. Really no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tons of flow! Too much for a small tank.
customer_reviews.text: It was a little loud depending on how it sat in the tank. But with some fiddling I could get it quiet. It was a little big for my tank and made too much current for our beta. He hated it. I cut open a water bottle and put it around the filter to reduce the current but he was already stressed too much and ended up dying. I wouldn't put this in a tank smaller than 7 gallons. It moves a bunch of water. The tank has never been more clear. Just beware.
customer_reviews.author: JG3

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't for me
customer_reviews.text: I found this filter not to be the best for my aquarium. It was quiet enough and the filter media easy enough to change, but being open seemed to contribute to evaporation more quickly than usual, and it seemed to "algae" up fairly quickly. I don't have an algae issue in the tank itself, but found this filter grew it in the far bottom corners where my fingers couldn't reach. Other people may like this, but I went with a different brand that makes a covered HOB filter.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but them quit after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: This filter was awesome!! It cleaned the tank quickly and lasted awhile before the water started clouding again. I was very impressed with how quiet it was. Unfortunately, after having it for less than 6 months the water wasn't getting very clear. I changed the filter 3 times thinking it was a bad filter. But then this morning it just stopped working. I am very disappointed that it didn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Severely underrated
customer_reviews.text: These filters do amazing work for the price. I primarily use them to create waterfalls in terrariums. If you seal up the mount holes at the back, these things pull water at an amazing rate and function down to very low water levels. They also seem impervious to clogging up. The only downside is the lack of lid, but I use pieces of cork bark to cover them and hide it. More cost effective and reliable that small water pumps.
customer_reviews.author: DarbX1605

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet, sitting 7ft away right now and can’t hear it. It’s a 2.5 gal tank with three little goldfish and they’re getting some extra exercise with the new water movement but I think the two smaller ones are having fun going behind it and going under where the water falls! Lol! After 5min running I can already see a difference in water clarity. Really glad I went with this!
customer_reviews.author: margo

customer_reviews.title: It's loud
customer_reviews.text: I have two 20 gallon tanks, one is a 20 tall and the other is a 20 long. I have been fishless cycling the 20 tall for three weeks with the Tetra Whisper IQ 20, and it is silent. I just got the Tetra Whisper 20i for the long tank to start fishless cycling it and it is very loud. I've had this filter in the 10i before and it is a great starter filter, but if you want a long term filter I suggest the Tetra IQ over this one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Malia

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price I paid! However, this thing is a pain in the butt to clean. The bottom needs to be screwed out in order to get all of the gunk out and that is a pain when it’s already wet. This also depends completely on how often you take it out to clean it! On the other end, the filters are super easy to replace (depending on which ones you buy). I’ve been using this for close to a year (woo hoo!) because the previous one finally lost its touch after about 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Mount broke, filter is unusable. Whisper won't sell or give me a new plastic mount.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Mount broke and whisper won't send me a new one. They do not stand behind their product. I'm supposed to throw out a working filter and buy a new one just for a mount that I would have paid for. I have this in a turtle tank with a small turtle and about 25 gallons. I went from full water changes weekly to after installing this I'm three weeks in with crystal clear water! Only complaint which is my fault; I thought it was fully submersible. It is not but it is almost silent anyway if the water line is high enough.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Another killed fish
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews about fish killed by this filter, the same thing happened to me. I have always been concerned about the high flow from this filter and even put some tape over part of the inflow holes. Just took a dead neon out of the filter. Will buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Product
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this product, I have decided to return it. I can see why fish are getting sucked in and killed. The propeller for the pump is right on top of the large hole at the bottom, where it draws in the water. I decided not to take my chance, as I have very small fish and I feared for their safety.
customer_reviews.author: ANONYMOUS

customer_reviews.title: Working good.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. My biggest complaint it the mounting. I can not get it to mount as high up as I would like, so I just keep the water level a little lower in the tank. As for noise level it is not bad for a filter, the trick to get it quite is to mount the discharge as close to the water line as possible. If you mount the discharge really high you will get a lot of water flowing noise.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRon

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money on something that works
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty disapointed with this product, when i first got this almost two months ago, it seem to work great, but i noticed after about two weeks, it didnt seem to circulate the water as well as it did when i got it even after cleaning the fan thing and replacing the filer, the water barley trickles now, I plan to replace this as soon as i can. I would rather spend a little more on a product that works.. then to have wasted the money on this
customer_reviews.author: Jeffnsara

customer_reviews.title: Gently moving yucky water around...
customer_reviews.text: Well it IS quiet, but it’s serving the purpose of a glorified ‘quiet’ water mover. I put it in the tank with a fresh water change three days ago and the water has started gradually getting cloudier and stinkier with fish waste. It’s a small tank with very few inhabitants, it should be filtering something out at least. The pump may not be up to standard on this unit, who knows. Not sure if I can return this after it’s been in the tank...  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Stefaronicus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Update: the smaller 10 gallon filter that I just bought in September has stopped working. My fish tank was looking dirty so I went to change some of the water. Well it turns out the filter had just stopped. 🤷‍♀️ I cleaned it and plugged it back in but the propeller on the inside won't turn on. I'm going to contact the company. Decent filter. I have purchased these for my red eared sliders and goldfish. The filter is easy to clean and the cartridge is pretty cheap if bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SweetSunniD

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research on good filters for turtles because they produce so much waste, I decided on this one because it has glowing reviews and is highly recommend. I honestly don't see how. After 15 months of use it's not worth it at all. The aquarium still required weekly deep cleaning because the water got so nasty. I'm finally giving up on this filter and getting something more powerful. We have a 20 long tank with less than 4 inches of water and no rocks or sand etcetera so it doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: 90bjdh

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought a smaller version from Walmart that didn't properly filter my terrarium which made me cautious about purchasing the same brand online, but I'm glad I did. Within 15 minutes of plugging in the filter the tank was spotless. I don't hear it at all and I haven't had to adjust either. My turtle sits under the spout and let's the water pour on her back, she's also happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Castlegirl

customer_reviews.title: Too Strong for a Small Betta Tank
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listened to a few other reviews. I bought this for my approximately 5 gallon betta tank because the whisper 3I that I had was constantly getting clogged, and just wasn't doing the greatest job at keeping the tank clean. I kept having issues with algae which did not help the situation. I bought this and it did an excellent job at keeping the tank clean, however my betta was miserable. He was constantly hiding behind the filter because it was just a little bit too strong. If you have a Betta, I bet this would do an excellent job in a 10 gallon aquarium, but anything smaller, it is just way too powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: My favorite filter for a 10 gallon tank. We had an external filter and I didn't realize what a crappy job it did until it stopped working completely and I bought this. My tank has never been so clean. i was happy (but horrified) at how clear it was, my poor fishies should have had this all along! I felt so bad that I didn't notice how poor my other filter was. It's very quiet, only hear a waterfall effect. It's quieter than my air bubbler! Very simple to use. I buy the disassembled filters, they are simple to use and more frugal :)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Middendorf

customer_reviews.title: NEARLY KILLED MY BETA FISH. STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Nearly killed my beta fish. This filter is too strong for a 3 gallon tank. My beta fish was sucked into It and injured his fins. He can now barley swim and sits at the bottom of the tank. I had to remove him from his original tank and put him into a small once because he is having a hard time reaching the top for air. So sad. DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE A BETA FISH.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've had this 10gal filter/waterfall in my makeshift goldfish container for 4-5 days now. Works perfectly as long as you don't tilt it backwards (the water will spill out the back). Very quiet, adjustable clip to vary height from water/water fall, and easy to install. I will not try until the filters need replacing, but looks easy to modify medium. My goldfish LOVES the bubbles produced an plays in them often. Highly recommend. Will check back if opinions change.
customer_reviews.author: Mutsima

customer_reviews.title: Betta fish fin torn!
customer_reviews.text: Never ever put this in a tank with a fish. It sucks up water from the bottom front, therefore the fish can easily get caught and sucked against it. My fish, before today, has been able to get away from it. But today it tore my betta fish’s fin. If you care for your fish at all you will avoid this product for the safety of your pet.
customer_reviews.author: The Happy Loving Allen Family

customer_reviews.title: This killed 2 of our pets.
customer_reviews.text: We lost (they died) a water snail and an african clawed frog due to an opening on the bottom of this filter. My daughter was/is very distraught. Our little friends were sucked up into the hole on the bottom and died. We sure hope this is addressed and corrected. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Patti Sommerfelt

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't keep the tank clean!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this filter for my beta tank, its just a small tank, and it stoped working in two days, and it didn't keep the water clean it started to got dirty as usual, I want my money back, but I just don't want to go all the way there to the ups. I don't recomend this product at all!!! I don't know how it got so many stars for such a poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel MV

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but can be made quieter with some hacks
customer_reviews.text: This filter runs quietly out of the box, but there is a dull, ongoing buzzing noise coming from the engine and the impeller. I put some petroleum jelly on the impeler axle and put my tank on top of a silicone drying mat (from Target) and I can barely hear my tank and this filter now. It's a huge plus since my tank is in my room and is two feet from my bed. The filtration is great and keeps my 3 gallon tank clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Pagulayan

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the 20 gallon version because it died on me. The 20 gallon version barely could keep my tank clean and i only have 5 tetras and a beta. Within a day of installing this my tank hasnt looked cleaner. Highly recommend this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy N.

customer_reviews.title: Occasional rock in moter. Wanted sand anyway.
customer_reviews.text: ... gravel sometimes gets stuck in it which is a slight inconvience, and it slows it down. Getting it out isn't hard or time consuming, but it's the only filter I've ever had to take pebbles out of.. but it's super quiet. I love the faint sound of water in the background. It's there but is faint enough to not bother even if in a bedroom. There probably are better filters out there but it does what its supposed to for my 20 gallon tank. Really just gives me half an excuse to replace the gravel with sand anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Zforzombie

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 1 month and return window closed
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after one month and a half. I purchased it on October 29 and now on December 18th Amazon says the return window is closed. Ridiculous! Save your money and buy a different filter. This one is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Kelley, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: This is probably made for a plastic or paper tank will not work with glass
customer_reviews.text: The biggest piece of garbage ever there’s not even a way to hold it on the side of the aquarium it’s only made for something plastic how do you even use this it doesn’t even set up on its own what a piece of trash! Garbage
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Powerful compact filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a decently powerful filter. I like the fact that it uses the large bio filters, the same as another larger model filter I have. My only complaints are that it takes up quite a bit of room in the tank and the hanging hook does not adjust to a higher height. I was able to finagle it to the appropriate height above the water line. Overall, the filter gets the job done effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapyard

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I know this one had some mixed review but I think it depends what you are using it for. I use it for a 10 gallon tank and it works perfectly. It is very quiet, the turtles love it. I am glad I went through with this one. It is perfect for the turtles as they grow up till they are ready for the pond. I suggest it for everyone but just be specific in your needs for your animals and the tank size.
customer_reviews.author: Tiane Marie

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I have used Whisper filters for my aquatic turtle tanks for years. They are hit and miss. I’ve had some last over a couple of years. This one Completely stopped working after two weeks. I do not recommend these even for the price. $15 every other month for a new filter (not including cartridge refills) adds up.
customer_reviews.author: Sulley71

customer_reviews.title: Great fish filter!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly have used a couple in-tank filters, this being one and I really like this one. The replacement bags are affordable and quick to change and it does the trick. I would recommend you experimenting with the size as I bought 3 before settling with the 10 gallon one. A little awkward since I had a 5 gallon tank and between the size stated.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter system!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these running in a 55 gallon tank for my turtles. It has been over a month that installed these, technically should be changing the filters however, no need just yet, the water is still crystal clear!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to use and sparkling clean water!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple aquariums and have tried numerous types of filters. Whisper filters are my favorite kind. Easy, quiet and they work to keep my water clean and clear! This is the only filter I will use!
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and very effective
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the quietest filter system I have ever used. I have one in my 2.5 gallon tank with a beta. One in my 10 gallon tank with tiger barbs. I am currently setting up my 55 gallon for an Oscar and will be using whisper filters in it as well. They will be two of the bigger ones. will review those once i get it all set up and let you know.Also filter bags are available locally for me and live in a very small town so a good be you can find them local as well as plenty on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the quietest pump I’ve ever had. My only issue is that it’s meant for 3-10 gallons, but in my 5 gallon tank for my Betta it’s pushing him all around. It also takes up a big part of his tank. But I love how quiet it is so for now it stays.
customer_reviews.author: BecsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this filter is great except that it’s extremely loud. It makes a grinding/rattling noise no matter what you do. I took it apart, cleaned/inspected the impeller, and couldn’t fix it. None of the outside plastic parts were making the noise either, it was coming from the motor. I purchased another one thinking mine might be defective but had the exact same problem. Many people have loud houses and don’t realize the noise this thing puts out. If you and your fish can live with that, then this is a great filter for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and functional
customer_reviews.text: Bought this filter for my 5 gallon Betta tank. I bought it because there are a lot of good reviews and it was very affordable. It arrived by estimated date. No damage to the package and package well. Only issue I had is the instruction were not very helpful but I managed to figure it out since it is really not a complicated filter. The filter is a bit big for my tank but i made it work. I could see the difference in the water after 5 mins. I really do like this filter an would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS FILTER!!
customer_reviews.text: Please, if you value your fish's life, do not buy this filter! I ignored the other warnings on here and bought it and my fish ended up losing his life. He was the prettiest blue Betts and my boys (5 and 3) adored him. Well, 2 days after buying it, his fins got caught in the bottom and he was so stuck, I had to actually pull on him. A few days later, he died. My youngest was absolutely devastated and cried for a long time. Please! DON'T BUY this filter!!
customer_reviews.author: Liahona W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.  Crystal clear tank.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great filter for my two and a half gallon betta tank. It keeps it crystal clear and just very easy just pop out the cartridge and put in a new one and every so often rinse out the filter itself. Simply hangs on to the back of the tank and plug in. Starts immediately by itself, no priming needed.
customer_reviews.author: barbara kearney

customer_reviews.title: Would give it 10 stars if I could!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these filters for use in my Budgett's frog's tank. I had been using a Tetra Reptofilter prior to that, and using the Reptofilter, I had to change the filter cartridge every week, and do a full water clean every three weeks. Using the Whisper, it has been a week and the water still looks cleaner than the day I put the new filter in! The build of the filter appears much more sturdy than the Reptofilter, and my fears of it falling apart like the last one did are completely gone. I couldn't recommend this more, especially if you have extremely slimy, messy reptiles or amphibians.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good flow
customer_reviews.text: The directions did not tell me how to adjust the flow and the filter leaves much to be desired. It will work better as a hydroponic pump than a fish tank filter.
customer_reviews.author: A P Murray

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! Amazing so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 yr. old RES that I recently had to take with me while heading out of town for a month, and because normally he occupies a 100 gallon tank which requires a powerful filtration system, the temporary 55 gallon tank I bought to use while away I was skeptical to get anything small but this is perfect! I swear it cleaned the entire tank within two hours and has kept it clean now for a month with zero issues! Best part is how easy it was to set up probably taking less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Skm

customer_reviews.title: unclear water
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a 30 gallon filter. My water never got as clear as my 30 gallon and some of my fish I had for years died. The filter was so cheap that I wanted to try it, even cheaper than my 30 gallon filter. I noticed that it said 40i, not just 40 I was wondering if that made a difference. The 40 is priced at about $29 dollars, anyway I put my 30 gallon back in and I have clear water again
customer_reviews.author: Betty Endsley

customer_reviews.title: Good in-tank filter, be wary if you have small fish
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for the past few months, with the usual in-tank filter problems, some of which are that it is aesthetically rather unpleasant to look at and is a bit big for its rating of 20 gallons max. However these are minor problems, and they don’t matter much in the day to day workings of the aquarium. Recently, a fish of mine got stuck in between the pinch point of the filter and glass, which is tight, and he died. If you don’t have any particularly small fish that could either get sucked into the intake vents or get stuck between the filter and glass, I would recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: George R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I do love this filter but it will not work on sand. I have a 30 gallon tank and the first time I placed it on the sand material it broke within two weeks. I had bought a replacement not realizing it was the sand and it broke again. However, once I changed up the tank (half with gravel half with sand) it worked perfectly. Very little to no noise and has a great flow. I definitely recommend it for people with bigger fish (small fish may get sucked into filter on bottom)
customer_reviews.author: Faithlyn Leach

customer_reviews.title: Betta injured by filter
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever written a review; I wish I would have taken other reviews more seriously. My betta’s fins were stuck in the filter within 5 minutes of using this product. I feel terribly as I did see other reviews note this, but only a few among many positive reviews. I’m hoping our daughter’s fish makes it through the night.
customer_reviews.author: RachDBQ

customer_reviews.title: Will suck up fish, must build cage around intake.
customer_reviews.text: Love this filter, it has kept my bait alive in a cooler for months now. Only problem is that fish get sucked up into the intake very easily. I had to build a cage around the pump which is fine for my use but isn’t ideal for someone intending to use this as a display tank. Bottom line perfect for bait, bad for pets.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pakulski

customer_reviews.title: In tank filters are the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I had been using HOB filters for a few years but in recent months they couldn't keep up with my three 7-8 inch goldfish, the water was always perpetually cloudy even after cleaning and water changes. I purchased the 40i for my 20 gallon tank. After 1 day I was startled to see a visible difference. Within 4 days I had clear water. I'm a believer, in tank filters are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I just don't know what I'm doing.... But this thing is horrible!!! Loud as can be - the filter cartridge and the scrubber plate are both floating and don't lock or clip in place.... I have it on the lowest position and had to take out about 2 inches of water in a 20 gallon tank. You get what you pay for - I DO NOT RECOMMEND - Probably can return it either !!! TRASH !!!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonistheBest

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listened to the reviews when I read that they were dangerous. I have a 4 gallon tank and my betta fish had always been an active little one. Two days into using this filter I noticed he wasn’t eating nor was he swimming around as usual. I noticed his fins were torn and kept my eye on him then I noticed he has a hard time swimming under the filter and his fins were getting sucked into the motor. I immediately turned it off and hoping my Blu heals.
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly a "Whisper" Filter
customer_reviews.text: This first two weeks the Filter was very quiet the third week and on it has become very loud. The water splashes from the filter into the tank instead of quietly flowing into the tank. I have another Whisper filter and it does not make noise or splash water from the filter to the tank like the second Whisper filter is doing. I don't know what the problem is with the second Whisper filter.
customer_reviews.author: amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 10 days
customer_reviews.text: I got the one for a 20 gallon on September 1st. Today September 10th it quit working. No idea why as it's in with a filter for a 55gallon aquarium too and both are in about 20 gallons of water in tote for my small 2.5 inch long turtles. Their water is clean but this filter for some reason just decided to stop working after 10 days. And I just ordered filters for it and now I can't buy another one because they are sold out
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rudie

customer_reviews.title: Have the filter away from the fish or put a sleeve over the bottom!
customer_reviews.text: I had just bought the most beautiful Betta and the second day of putting this filter on his tank, the filter suction area had my fish by his tail and it killed him... I cried and felt so horrible. There should be a warning or add an additional outskirt to protect people’s pets. Heartbreaking 💔
customer_reviews.author: Chris/ CRYSTAL

customer_reviews.title: The 10i is not suitable for 10 gallons at all.
customer_reviews.text: With a single goldfish in a 10 gallon tank, after only 2 weeks the tank is filthy to the point where I can't even see my fish. Now I have to either get another filter and hope it can clean it out or I'm stuck trying to dump a heavy 10 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: Strike Commando

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally got the 10 gallon one for my 20 gallon tank but it cleaned it just fine. The tank was kind of cloudy but after about 2 hours it’s pretty clear. Easy to setup, the noise is a low hum
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna Freytes

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IT WILL KILL YOUR FISH
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a filter to kill your fish this is the one. I went to go check on my new betta and found him sucked up into the bottom of the filter. The most heart breaking thing I've experienced with my fish. I would not reccomend this product to my worst enemy. HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Pyne

customer_reviews.title: Unstable mounting options for 40gal
customer_reviews.text: I’m a relatively new aquarist and have had this for just over a month. It works ok and is pretty quiet, but seriously needs a better mounting system. It has two options. Either a very thin hook and nothing securing the bottom, that drops it too low so I also need to drop the water level. Or two small suction cups that are the same as for my 10gallon. Both cannot be used at the same time. Ultimately I’ve decided to go with something else. Just sad I came to that conclusion too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: DesertRose

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the quietest filter I've owned besides an internal sponge...
customer_reviews.text: Dont' think, just buy. Ignore the negative reviews, mostly people think tank filters are supposed to clean up the mess they created by not knowing how to take care of a fish tank. Get it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: TheBests

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Topfin brand filter that was doing very poorly. So far the difference is night and day. The tank cleared up in minutes. It is very quiet too. It doesn't make a lot of water movement which is great for my Betta. The tetra replacement cartridge prices are way cheaper than the ones I was buying at PetSmart.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Page Gettys

customer_reviews.title: works great, clear water with no noise
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in a 20 gallon tank that has one 11 year old comet gold fish. Previous filter supposedly was for up to 60 gallon tank. Installed this filter without changing the water, in one day the water was much more clear. Added bonus, this unit is quiet compared to the previous one. We change out half the water every other week because gold fish produce so much waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was adjustable, but other than that it’s great. Filters are affordable and it appears to be easy to clean although I haven’t had to do it yet. The pump itself doesn’t make noise, but the gushing water does if you don’t place it at exactly the right height. My water is crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks! Literally lol 🦖
customer_reviews.text: Thing is super quiet and takes up little space. After reading another review, I decided to tuck it behind a little fake plant to keep my super awesome goldfish from getting sucked in. It does prevent it from getting everything. Over all though it still keeps my tank clean and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Awesome for 5 gallon reef in my bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Using this filter for a little 5 gallon reef aquarium. Visually it's a bit large in the tank but it provides adequate flow for the inhabitants (1 ocellaris clown and some hermit crabs) It's also in my bedroom and it generates no noise!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce C.

product_meta.title: Whisper In-Tank Filter with BioScrubber for aquariums
product_meta.description: Size:Up to 40-GallonsFor the ultimate in convenience and quiet, choose a Whisper In-Tank Filter. These filters mount on the inside of the aquarium, rather than hanging from the outside -- making it possible to place the tank flush against a wall. In-Tank Filters are unusually quiet, since the motor is under the water. Offering the same quality and performance as an external filter, the Whisper In-Tank Filter will function in as little as 2 inches of water -- making it ideal for turtle tanks, or for creating a waterfall inside the tank.The Whisper In-Tank filter features adjusts easily to high or low water levels with mounting suction cups and/or bracket. Each filter comes with one pre-assembled Whisper Bio-Bag filter cartridge.
feature_bullets: Included Components: Whisper In-Tank Filter 40i (upto 40 Gal)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
